conbody.p: A dataset is a specific view of data in that is accessible toa given set of users. The users working with the dataset must have a role of . The view provided by the dataset can be across multiple data collections.
Any data elements from any data collection may be included in a dataset. Defining a dataset does not modify configuration for data collections or impact protections to data.

Datasets are typically created for research or exploratory data use, and the intended use for datasets may differ from the intended use of an individual data collection. In particular, the governance and controls required for a dataset may differ from those specified its constituent data collections. For this reason, you can attach an access policy to a dataset that is independent of the access policies attached to the consistuent data collections.

Once a dataset is built by a , it can be executed by users with a role of . A single dataset can be executed by multiple users--even by users with different authorizations. A given user's actual view into the data in an executed dataset is restricted by his or her authorization. Thus, two users with different authorizations might execute the same dataset but end up with a different set of data.
